events.description: The Bank of England's scheduled interest rate decision and release of meeting minutes.

events.event_name: Appointment of Peter Mandelson as UK ambassador to the US
events.description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer appointed Peter Mandelson to the diplomatic role, sparking controversy.

facts.fact_text: UK 10-year gilt yields reached 4.6%, the highest level since mid-October.

evidences.evidence_text: UK 10-year gilt yields climbed to 4.6%, their highest level since mid-October

facts.fact_text: The spread between two- and 10-year gilts widened to its largest since 2018.

evidences.evidence_text: The spread between two- and 10-year gilts widened to its largest since 2018

facts.fact_text: The Bank of England's benchmark interest rate is currently 3.75%.

evidences.evidence_text: leave the benchmark interest rate unchanged at 3.75%

claims.claim_text: Renewed political uncertainty is pressuring longer-dated debt.

evidences.evidence_text: renewed political uncertainty pressured longer-dated debt ahead of the Bank of England’s policy announcement

claims.claim_text: The Bank of England is widely expected to keep interest rates unchanged.
claims.author: markets

evidences.evidence_text: the Bank of England is widely expected to leave the benchmark interest rate unchanged at 3.75%

claims.claim_text: Mandelson's appointment has raised questions about the durability of Starmer's leadership.

evidences.evidence_text: raised fresh questions about the durability of Starmer’s leadership

claims.claim_text: The next move in interest rates is likely to be downward.
claims.author: policymakers

evidences.evidence_text: policymakers continue to signal that the next move in rates is likely downward

evidence.evidence_text: renewed political uncertainty pressured longer-dated debt
Political risk has intensified following Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s appointment of Peter Mandelson
the Bank of England is widely expected to leave the benchmark interest rate unchanged at 3.75%
highlighting growing term premia and investor unease
